description.value:
Each Tinkering Kit includes and requires the common following equipment pieces to be used:

  • Screwdriver (@Compendium[undertaking.weapons.4XDEFIHFNG2WNIOR]{Dagger}, without the Thrown trait)
  • Wrench (@Compendium[undertaking.weapons.TYZX5I6N2G9F1XZE]{Club})

If you have Tinkering Trade Proficiency, you can use the Tinkering Kit in the following ways: 

  • Create Trinket: You can create one non-mechanized trinket or small object. So long as you have relevant materials equal to ¾ of the trinket’s cost, you can work on creating the item over the course of short or long rests. Each Rest Action you spend working on it, make an Intelligence (Craft) check against DC 10. Each success counts as 1 completed work session; a failure does not. Depending on the item’s actual cost, it takes more work sessions to complete.
  • Create Simple Gadget: As a Rest Action, you can create one common gadget—two as a Long Rest Action. Each gadget can be made from Scrap Metal of an equal GP value:
    • A crossbow (Light, Hand, Heavy, or Repeating)
    • A hunting trap
    • A lighter
    • A lock
  • Create Complex Gadget: Over the course of one or more Rest Actions, you can create one intricate item of clockwork, gadgetry, or otherwise. These can vary and some have special effects.
    • Create Clockwork Toy (1 Scrap Metal, 1 rest): You can create a simple clockwork toy that is no larger than a few inches. You decide what it looks like when you make it, but it always has a small winding key to activate it. The toy does up to two simple actions once wound-up, and can only be wound enough to act for up to 1 minute: 
      • Walk 5 ft forward.
      • Make a clicking or dinging noise.
      • Grab and hold an object less than 1lb in size near it.
      • Activate upon motion instead of winding.
      • Light up like a built-in lighter to cast 5 ft of light.
    • Create Timepiece (2 Scrap Metal, 2 rests): You can create a watch or clock that tells the time.
    • Create Impact Capsule (1 Scrap Metal, 1 rest): You can create a capsule that, when a pin is pulled from it, will explode its contents out into a 10 ft radius around where it next impacts. Contents can be anything that can fit inside a baseball, including liquids like water, oil, or potions without the corrupted or thickened modifiers, smoke or gas canisters, even ball bearings or a letter. Impact Capsules break once activated, with all Scrap Metal used to make it too damaged for reusage.
      • Add Lighting Mechanism (1 Scrap Metal, 1 rest): Once you have created an Impact Capsule, you can add a mechanism to cause a spark upon impact, causing anything flammable inside of it to light on fire.
    • Create Music Box (5 Scrap Metal, 3 rests): You can create a box that, when wound, plays a simple tune. You can create new songs for the box by using an additional 1 Scrap Metal.
  • Repair Trinket or Gadget: You can repair a fully broken trinket or gadget at ½ the material cost in ½ the sessions using the Tinkercraft Table below. Partially damaged objects require fewer parts and less time to repair, ask your GM for the difficulty and cost of a partial repair. Intelligence (Craft) checks to repair parts have a DC of 12.
  • Repair Ammunition: As a Rest Action, you can repair up to 5 broken ammunition.
  • Repair Construct: Over a Rest Action, you can repair damage to a Construct using 1 Scrap Metal. Make a DC 10 Intelligence (Craft) check. On success, the Construct restores hit points equal to 1d10 + your Intelligence (Craft) Modifier. On failure, restore 1d4 + your Proficiency instead.
